results.headline: Is He Insane? No, He’s Larry

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Witless Protection

results.summary_short: In “Witless Protection,” Larry the Cable Guy plays a small-town deputy, fantasizing about becoming an F.B.I. agent. Sitcom wackiness ensues.

results.headline: Behind the Mask of Civility, the Battles Rage On

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Duchess of Langeais

results.summary_short: Jacques Rivette’s “Duchess of Langeais” seems to me a nearly impeccable work of art — beautiful, true, profound.

results.headline: Triple Threat

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Signal

results.summary_short: This three-part horror movie directed by a trio of Atlanta filmmakers is set during the collapse of Terminus, a fictional city whose citizens are being driven to rage.

results.headline: Eden Corrupted

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Cover

results.summary_short: The flesh is weak but the spirit is indestructible in “Cover,” a ham-fisted morality tale.

results.headline: The Cost of Collusion, Paid in Phony Currency

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Counterfeiters

results.summary_short: Like most films about the Holocaust, “The Counterfeiters,” a brisk, tough movie from the Austrian director Stefan Ruzowitzky, is a survivor’s tale.

results.headline: High School’s the Same; the Drugs Have Changed

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Charlie Bartlett

results.summary_short: Two decades after Ferris Bueller, a new smarty-pants seeks popularity in “Charlie Bartlett.”

results.headline: One Assassination Attempt, a Multitude of Perspectives

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Vantage Point

results.summary_short: “Vantage Point,” a gimmick in search of a point, is nothing if not, er, timely.

results.headline: A Muslim and a Hindu. Let’s Dance.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The High School Experience

results.summary_short: They may not make ’em like they used to in Hollywood, but sometimes in India they still do.

results.headline: A Brazilian Boy, Alone in the Tumult of 1970
results.display_title: The Year My Parents Went on Vacation

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Year My Parents Went on Vacation

results.summary_short: “The Year My Parents Went on Vacation” is most seductive when it focuses on the details of daily life in the lower-middle-class São Paulo neighborhood Bom Retiro.

results.headline: Filmmakers Who Become Their Own Zombie Movie
results.display_title: George A. Romero's Diary of the Dead

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of George A. Romero's Diary of the Dead

results.summary_short: In “George A. Romero’s Diary of the Dead,” we meet the enemy and he is us, with video cameras.

results.headline: No Mickey Mouse Stuff
results.display_title: The 2008 Academy Award Nominated Short Films

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The 2008 Academy Award Nominated Short Films

results.summary_short: In the 2007 Academy Award nominated short films, digital wizardry meets life-and-death dramas.

results.headline: Love, Sex, Belly Dancing and Religious Differences

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of David & Layla

results.summary_short: The star-crossed romance “David & Layla” is layered with sharply observed cultural details.

results.headline: Social Equality Comes With a Beat, Again

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Step Up 2 The Streets

results.summary_short: “Step Up 2 the Streets” posits a universe where racial and class differences are minor obstacles to fun and pretends its clichés aren’t clichés.

results.headline: A House Divided by Old Magic and New Residents

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Spiderwick Chronicles

results.summary_short: Instead of the kind of inspired imaginative synergy that distinguished the “Lord of the Rings,” “The Spiderwick Chronicles” feels more like a sloppy, secondhand pander.

results.headline: How I Met Your Mother: A History Lesson in Love

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Definitely, Maybe

results.summary_short: “Definitely, Maybe,” written and directed by Adam Brooks, is a nimble and winning little romance.

results.headline: Time-Space Continuum? No Big Deal. And the Swag...

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Jumper

results.summary_short: “Jumper” is a barely coherent genre mishmash about a guy who transports himself across the globe at will.

results.headline: Innocence Lost, on a Battlefield Somewhere in Africa

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Ezra

results.summary_short: “Ezra” is a scorching portrait of an African child who is kidnapped and turned into a soldier for a rebel militia.

results.headline: Family Legends
results.display_title: Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

results.summary_short: “Bab’Aziz” is a structurally audacious fairy tale that imparts moral lessons and shows how narratives reflect and shape life.

results.headline: Healing Cultural Wounds

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Walk to Beautiful

results.summary_short: “A Walk to Beautiful” is a complex and quietly devastating indictment of chauvinist societies.

results.headline: Sharpshooters of Comedy Hit the Road (Duck!)
results.display_title: Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights--Hollywood to the Heartland

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show: 30 Days & 30 Nights--Hollywood to the Heartland

results.summary_short: “Vince Vaughn’s Wild West Comedy Show” imagines itself a contemporary equivalent of rootin’- tootin’ traveling entertainments like Buffalo Bill’s Wild West Show. That’s a tall comparison to draw.
